intro: Brassica heterophylla, commonly known as the variable cabbage or variable mustard, is a species of flowering plant in the family Brassicaceae. It is characterized by its variable leaf morphology, which can range from smooth and broad to narrow and lobed depending on environmental conditions. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–100 cm and produces small, yellow flowers arranged in racemes. Its fruit is a cylindrical silique containing several seeds. Brassica heterophylla is native to Australia and is often found in disturbed soils and coastal areas.
